channel.title: MidwestWeekends - Travel in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa
channel.description: Up-to-date information on travel in the Upper Midwest

item.title: Minocqua's white magic
item.description: In northeast Wisconsin, a forest full of snow delights skiers and snowmobilers.

item.title: Browsing in Boulder Junction
item.description: A fishing and resorts mecca in northwoods Wisconsin has become a fashionable place to shop.

item.title: Summer in Minocqua
item.description: In Wisconsin's north woods, vacationers flock to this Island City.

item.title: Gawking in Lake Geneva
item.description: On a mansion-lined footpath, walking is a spectator sport.

item.title: Under one roof in Duluth
item.description: On a cold-weather getaway, friends indulge in antiques, chocolate, craft beer and massages.

item.title: Wings over the Mississippi
item.description: Along the river in Minnesota and Wisconsin, tundra-swan watchers have a honkin' good time during the November migration.

item.title: Marvels of Starved Rock
item.description: In northern Illinois, a lovely state park draws crowds to its riverside cliffs and forest canyons.

item.title: Waupaca's Chain O' Lakes
item.description: Around a historic Yankee town, visitors travel by water and by land.

item.title: Wausau's liquid assets
item.description: In this sporty town on the Wisconsin River, just go with the flow.

item.title: Winter in Wausau
item.description: In winter, this modest paper town offers skiing, dining and sightseeing.

item.title: On the wine trail
item.description: In November, taste the fruits of the harvest on winery road trips.

item.title: Following a wine trail
item.description: On winery tours, sample fruits of the harvest.
